page.title: 15END OF THE LINE.
page.content: Shildon railway stands alone Dirty, ragged, unused tracks, All rusty and black. Sleepers whose bolts are ever so slack, amid the decaying, dreary sight. It's so sad that it's left to rust. The buildings are cracked and covered in dust. Slowly changing to a ghost town. Will it eventually all fall down? As I peered down from the wooden bridge, I imagined the locos thundering by. Clouds of steam and burning coal Created an immense dust bowl. It was noisy and busy, men laboured, their heads dizzy. Two of the tracks were shining bright. The only survivors which still are used. They are not dirty, ragged or bruised.
